intro: Psoralea pubescens var. lasiostachys, commonly known as the hairy psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by pod-like fruits. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
